title: 108_hr43
content: The Act titled "Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 2003" repeals the alternative minimum tax on corporations. The Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 2003 eliminates the alternative minimum tax on corporations for taxable years starting after December 31, 2002. The credit for prior year minimum tax liability is limited under the amended section 53 of the Internal Revenue Code. The Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 2003 eliminates the alternative minimum tax on corporations for taxable years starting after December 31, 2002. The limitation for corporations is determined without regard to certain provisions and by taking into account only a percentage of the tentative minimum tax. The Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 2003 eliminates the alternative minimum tax on individuals for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2002. The applicable percentage decreases over the years, starting at 80% in 2003 and reaching 0% in 2007 and thereafter. The Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 2003 eliminates the alternative minimum tax on individuals starting in 2003, with the tentative minimum tax being zero for taxpayers after December 31, 2012. Exemption amounts for individuals are increased immediately. The Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 2003 eliminates the alternative minimum tax on individuals starting in 2003, with exemption amounts increased immediately. Amendments to section 55(d) of the Code adjust exemption amounts for taxpayers after 2003. In subparagraph (A), the applicable percentage is determined according to a table. The applicable percentage for calendar years 2004 to 2012 increases incrementally from 10 to 90. If the amount is not a multiple of $5, it is rounded. The tax code is amended to allow nonrefundable personal credits against regular tax liability. The aggregate amount of credits allowed for the year cannot exceed the regular tax liability reduced by the foreign tax credit and the tax imposed by section 55(a). Additionally, the limitation on the use of credit for prior year minimum tax is addressed. The tax code is amended to limit the use of credit for prior year minimum tax liability for individuals starting after 2012. The credit allowable to a taxpayer other than a corporation cannot exceed 90% of the excess of regular tax liability over certain specified credits. Effective date for these amendments is after December 31, 2002.
